actions.detail: You force the target’s reactor to eject burning liquid in a Burst 2 area around them, not affecting the space they occupy. The affected area becomes difficult terrain and characters that start their turn in it or that enter it for the first time in a round must succeed on an Engineering save or take 2 Heat and 1 Burn. The liquid cools, dissipating, at the end of your next turn.
actions.name: Eject Slag

actions.detail: Until the end of the target’s next turn, their reactor shielding is temporarily cracked. They take 2 Burn for each space they voluntarily move (to a maximum of 6 Burn).
actions.name: Molten Puncture

system.description: The Kobold PG’s code is unique in that it can be injected into existing civilian mining mechs, allowing them to interact with the full suite of largely improvised, adapted weaponry and systems. The process skips printers entirely; however, in avoiding the constraints of Unionmonitored printers, the process also eschews widely accepted safety standards – a common theme among HORUS PGs. With no governors or consistent standards on the operational envelope of the K-PG, some pilots have discovered the terminal limits of their chassis the hard way.
